name: sprite stops
content:
Sprite stops doing the specified behavior.

(Opens YouTube in new tab)

[![How To Make A Sprite](https://img.youtube.com/vi/VUmZ2IsFAGo/0.jpg)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VUmZ2IsFAGo)


For more information see `Adding and Removing Behaviors`.

examples.name: Example 1
examples.description: The phone will “ring” until the person touches and answers it.

examples.name: Example 2
examples.description: If a sprite is doing multiple behaviors, individual behaviors can still be controlled and stopped. Click on the star to make it stop growing.

palette_params.name: behavior
palette_params.description: The  selected the behavior to stop

palette_params.name: sprite
palette_params.description: The sprite or sprite group stopping the behavior

tips: - Connect this block to events like `sprite clicked`. Code is executed quickly in Sprite Lab. If you tell a sprite to begin a behavior and then tell it to stop in the same sequence of code, there is not enough time to see the behavior in action.
